intro: Pilosella bonaquae, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is adapted to high-altitude environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Pilosella bonaquae is known for its delicate, hairy leaves and is often found in alpine meadows.
